meanings.definition: Strewments: things that are scattered or spread out
meanings.sent1: The strewments of colorful leaves covered the ground after the wind blew them off the trees.
meanings.sent2: She carefully picked up the strewments of papers that had fallen from her desk.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy thought the strewments of toys were meant for a game of chase.
meanings.sent4: The strewments of stars in the night sky created a breathtaking view.
meanings.sent5: The artist used the strewments of paint on the canvas to create a beautiful masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Strewments: the act of scattering or spreading things out
meanings.sent1: The strewments of seeds in the garden ensured a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent2: His quick strewments of sand on the icy path prevented anyone from slipping.
meanings.sent3: The magician's strewments of glitter added a touch of magic to the performance.
meanings.sent4: Her strewments of kindness throughout the community made her a beloved figure.
meanings.sent5: The chef's precise strewments of herbs enhanced the flavor of the dish.
